title: UK Government Data Quality Framework
description: Comprehensive framework providing principles, lifecycle guidance, and practical tools for assessing and improving data quality in public sector organisations. Emphasises creating a culture of data quality through proactive, evidence-based approaches rather than one-off fixes.

title: UNICEF Data Quality Framework
description: International framework aligning with UN statistical quality assurance principles. Covers key quality dimensions (accuracy, completeness, timeliness) with practical application guidance for development contexts, particularly relevant for resource-constrained environments.

title: Open Data Quality Measurement Framework
description: Academic research comparing data quality between centralised and decentralised government data release strategies. Identifies common problems like lack of metadata and incomplete data, providing actionable metrics and assessment methodologies for open government data.

title: Rwanda's DHIS2 Health Management Information System
description: Case study of Rwanda's successful national health data system rollout, demonstrating how cross-disciplinary teams combined technical, organisational, and managerial skills. Achieved 98% data completeness through embedded validation rules and intensive training across all levels.

title: DHIS2 Data Quality in Sub-Saharan Africa
description: Research providing a roadmap for improving health data quality in low- and middle-income countries, including immediately actionable solutions like standardised data cleaning pipelines and methods for identifying high-performing facilities based on data quality.

title: ODI - What Are Data Institutions and Why Are They Important?
description: Explains how organisations can steward data on behalf of others towards public, educational, or charitable aims. Covers different stewardship models including protecting sensitive data, combining data from multiple sources, and creating open datasets.

title: Open Data Policy Lab Executive Education Programme
description: Free executive education programme for data stewards, covering evolution of data reuse, logic models for measuring impact, and strategies for institutionalising data reuse. Includes case studies from organisations pioneering data stewardship approaches.

title: Colombia's SISBEN System: Lessons in Data Quality and Social Justice
description: Critical analysis of Colombia's welfare targeting system, which introduced data stewardship performance indicators requiring officials to be evaluated on data completeness, accuracy, and timeliness alongside programme outcomes. Discusses both successes and challenges of data-driven social policy.
